1. Excellent screen.

Internal speaker is bad. Yes sound is bad but the positioning of the speaker makes it possible to hear easily while the phone is in pocket. Headphones: there are no included headphones in the box but the jack is universally compatible. The review here is opposite. As bad the internal speaker is, the sound through headphones is extremely Good. You will definately think as if you are having some home theatre with you.
 
Overall the handset is very very good that to at the price point we are getting it. It is excellent. If you watch a lot of videos than please buy a 4-10$ Headset. Sound through Headset is very good.

My first reason to buy it was the 4 GB of RAM, and it did solve the problems I had before with apps that took ages to start, or choked. Unfortunately, it looks like Android is slowly and progressively wasting my memory resources, and I think that is due to app updates, not a phone fault.  
I also enjoy using the fingerprint sensor to quickly unlock the phone, and contrary to others, never had problems with it. I wish it could be used in apps as well, but it looks like I have to wait for Android 6 to be available. 
The battery does drain in less than a day if I surf the Internet using mobile data half a dozen times. This happens to me on weekends. 
One thing that really annoys me is the sharing of contacts via Bluetooth with my car hands free system. But I found in the net users with all kinds of different phones complaining. It's Android 5's fault. The latest oneplus version now transfers contacts, but, unfortunately, a person with multiple numbers is being replicated at the car. My older phone with an older Android version showed a single contact at the car and allowed me to select its desired number. 
Sometimes, I lose the GSM signal while other people around me have three bars of strength. Android's fault again?  
Photographs wise, I had to install a different camera app, because the default one distorted the images. 
I would have preferred the speakers to be located elsewhere because when I hold the phone with a single hand, my fingers obstruct the sound.  
In short, it is a good phone!

It deteriorated, with erosion and parts falling apart. I complained and got to know from Oneplus that the warranty for accessories is only 15 days. All in all it's a great phone and if minor things wrong with it don't bother you, you should definitely get it!

Oneplus 2, My Review after 15 days.  
    Some history first, i came to know abt oneplus a year back. At that time i read some reviews and watched mkbhd and barnaculas nerdgasm videos on YouTube and opo impressed me a lot. At that time i needed a dual sim device as i used to travel interstate.  Still this phone had me hooked so much that i bought it on Jan 2015. My previous phones where xperia ray,  galaxy note 1 and xolo q800 (still working and too good). First thing i noticed was the camera quality of the new opo dint impress me.  Neither did the short usb cable which became loose after 1 day. I was also not impressed with opo battery life unlike others who experienced great battery life.  So after about 20 days i sold it.  From then on i was waiting patiently for oneplus' next phone.  When i came to kno abt the registration i registered in opo immediately.  Then i realised that list is not permanent and had to so some spamming to bump my position. When the released opo i thought i ll get the invite easily as i was below 1k in  tge registration list.  But to. my surprise i came to know that its not the priority list for distributing invite.  I was disappointed and thought i  wait till 20 th Aug or else i ll buy another phone.  Somehow i got invite on 19th and OP2 on 22nd.  
       From then on am using it extensively. At first i dint like the weight of op2. Am used to it now and even hav an armour case. Phone feels really solid in the hand and the sandstone back (more rough this time)  is super  grippy.  Feels great to hold.  After 2 days and installing all apps i felt the battery life to be poor with SOT of about 3.5 hrs.  As a friend suggested i charged the phone overnight for 2 days and made some tweaks on the phone and the life improved to abt 4.5 hrs of SOT which is good to last a typical day. i dont play much but i hav installed many games like asphalt 8, wwe etc.  One thing which amazed me was that while gaming OP2 dint drain much battery unlike other phones.  Its a great newz for gamers.  
  Kudos to Oneplus team for rolling out updates so soon.  i must say that after the 2nd update the battery life improved even more with more than 5.5 hrs of SOT which is awesome.  
     Yes there are some glitches, oxygen os is not polished.  
The finger print sensor may not work if u keep the phone idle for 30 mins or more how. much ever you try. Am sure it will be solved soon. To make fingerprint faster its better to use jus one finger print. There is no issue with home button too if u disable fingerprint.  
     Camera seem to be good enough for me and takes some fantastic shots.  Front cam too is good.  
    Screen is bright and crisp.  
          I am not happy with the loudspeaker. Its weaker than opo. But if u use a good headphone its good. The wifi connectivity is average. Voice clarity and reception also are great.  
    Another glitch is that if u use dual sim, sometimes the phone decides itself which sim is default for calling, even if u set it as "ask everytime".  It was the most annoying thing for me.  
   Charging time is about 2 hr 25 mins and 24 % in 30 mins.  Its not too bad, but will miss quick charging.  Also u ll need usb type c cables or adaptor if u need to charge it somwer else or in ur car.  
Heating issue?  Not so much..  Only on gaming and that too not unbearable.  
      Overall am satisfied with OP2 so far.  I have never used NFC or am not a fan of wireless charging.. Hope Oneplus will iron out the oxygen os and make our experience better. If your inventory is stagnet with too many devices you are essentially making an investment with no return. Its like putting money in a bank account that just keeps it.
